page.title: 08CROSSTOWN KNUTSFORD
page.content: About half the Crosstown area of Knutsford falls within our survey. This part of town too is almost entirely residential but different in character from the Shaw Heath and Longridge estates previously described. The housing here is a mixture of council- and privately- owned dwellings (some very expensive). Many of the people who live here commute out of Knutsford to work. There are 3 schools in Crosstown; St. Vincent's R C Aided Primary School which takes children aged 5-11 from a very wide area, Crosstown County Infant School (ages 5-7) and, adjacent to this, Norbury Booths County Junior School (ages 7-11). At the southern end, and once on the outskirts of the town, is the base of a well-established Nursery and Garden Centre around which houses have grown.
